items.title: Syntax warning due to comparison of literals using is
Feature Request: Pass in list of passwords, get list of scores back
items.body: I'm using zxcvbn on large lists (~70K) of passwords and calling zxcvbn individually this many times is very slow. I would like to pass in a list of passwords and get a list of scores back. Thank you

items.title: 4.4.28 tag is missing compared to PyPI
items.body:
Was it actually released? If so what commit the release corresponds to? I'm curious whether to package it downstream.

https://pypi.org/project/zxcvbn/4.4.28/
https://repology.org/project/python:zxcvbn/versions

items.title: Useful feature unreleased
items.body:
Hi, thanks to all contributors for writing this, its made a great password checker accessible to me as a python dev.

My only issue right now is that it has been a while since release [v4.4.27](https://github.com/dwolfhub/zxcvbn-python/releases/tag/v4.4.27) and since then there haven't been many releases. I think the feature merged in #43 would be really great to be released.

Are there upcoming release plans?

items.title: Release notes / changelog
items.body: Does this project have any release notes or a running changelog? I prefer to look at some documentation before updating a package.

items.title: lint report
items.body:
python setup.py lint 
(OR)
flake8

report large number of errors.

items.title: OverflowError
items.body:
I haven't been able to reproduce yet, but one of our users selected a password that generated an OverflowError in `zxcvbn`:

```
OverflowError: int too large to convert to float
  ...
  File "warehouse/forms.py", line 60, in __call__
    results = zxcvbn(field.data, user_inputs=user_inputs)
  File "zxcvbn/__init__.py", line 31, in zxcvbn
    result = scoring.most_guessable_match_sequence(password, matches)
  File "zxcvbn/scoring.py", line 200, in most_guessable_match_sequence
    bruteforce_update(k)
  File "zxcvbn/scoring.py", line 160, in bruteforce_update
    update(m, l + 1)
  File "zxcvbn/scoring.py", line 117, in update
    pi *= optimal['pi'][m['i'] - 1][l - 1]
```

items.title: release transitional package to zxcvbn-python on PyPI
items.body: should be v5, containing only a setup.py that prints a deprecation warning and depends on 'zxcvbn'

items.title: user_inputs argument
items.body:
I think that 'user\_inputs' argument is not working correctly, e.g.
```python
>>> from zxcvbn import zxcvbn
>>> zxcvbn('i love you')['score']
3
>>> zxcvbn('i love you', user_inputs=['love'])['score']
3
>>> zxcvbn('i love you', user_inputs=['love', 'you'])['score']
3
>>> zxcvbn('i love you', user_inputs=['i', 'love', 'you'])['score']
3
```

items.title: set up travis ci to run tests
DeprecationWarning on Python 3.6
items.body:
The following warning is shown when using Python 3.6:

`WARNING (py.warnings#99) zxcvbn/scoring.py:282: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \d
    if re.compile('\d').match(first_chr):`

This is easily solved by prepending these string literals with a 'r':

`    if re.compile(r'\d').match(first_chr):`

items.title: How do I find entropy bits?
items.body:
I noticed that on Dropbox's introduction page of [zxcvbn](https://blogs.dropbox.com/tech/2012/04/zxcvbn-realistic-password-strength-estimation/) and their original [python-zxcvbn](https://github.com/dropbox/python-zxcvbn) contain a key `entropy`.

Is there any interest in having some of the entropy functions for [scoring.py](https://github.com/dropbox/python-zxcvbn/blob/bc1c2d32d92dc83a384da446edd7ca54e71eb9d9/zxcvbn/scoring.py#L43) ported over to this project?

items.title: User inputs ignored?
items.body:
I've replaced original library (from dropbox) with this one and couple of my tests started to fail. On inspection it seems that user inputs are being ignored:

    >>> zxcvbn('JohnSmith123')['score']
    2
    >>> zxcvbn('JohnSmith123', ['John', 'Smith'])['score']
    2
I've expected to get 0 on the second one. Note, both examples return 0 in the original library.

items.title: zxcvbn is not thread safe
items.body:
`zxcvbn.zxcvbn(password, user_inputs)` is not thread safe, because it calls `matching.set_user_input_dictionary(...)` which puts state into a module global variable `RANKED_DICTIONARIES`

This can lead to incorrect behaviour if two threads are concurrently calling this function with different user_inputs.

items.title: Unicode in user_inputs
items.body:
User-inputs containing Unicode symbols -- Cyrillic in particular, in my case -- crash zxcvbn-python in python 2.7:
```
Python 2.7.12 (default, Nov 19 2016, 06:48:10) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from zxcvbn import zxcvbn
>>> zxcvbn("password", user_inputs=[u'Фамилия'])
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/kursitet/app/platform-env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/zxcvbn/__init__.py", line 12, in zxcvbn
    sanitized_inputs = [str(arg).lower() for arg in user_inputs]
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in position 0-6: ordinal not in range(128)
>>> 
```
While I understand it might not actually be handled properly in the first place, due to intricacies related to how Russian-speaking users use Cyrillic strings in passwords *(they typically transliterate them or use keyboard layout based substitution)* I'm pretty sure it shouldn't just fail with an exception.

items.title: zxcvbn throws OverflowError
items.body:
Hello, fellows.

I found out, that for some looong text zxcvbn throws OverflowError.
Code example:

```
import string
import random
from zxcvbn import zxcvbn

text = ''.join([random.choice(string.ascii_letters) for _ in range(310)])
zxcvbn(text)
```

Don't know if it needs to be clear in docs, or some hack for long text input or rewrite math operations to `Decimal`?

items.title: Internationalization
items.body:
It would be nice if the data files would be configurable to allow for word lists from other languages. It would also be nice if the feedback strings would be enclosed in gettext calls to allow for translations.

Would you consider changes to accommodate internationalization?

items.title: Python 2 syntax in __init__.py
items.body:
`__init__.py` calls the `print` command with the Python 2 syntax (no parentheses), which crashs the example script with

```
SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'
```

items.title: Add comparison to dropbox/python-zxcvbn
items.body:
Hi.

Could you please add in the README a comparison between this project and https://github.com/dropbox/python-zxcvbn ?

items.title: Matching recent year throws TypeError
items.body:
Passing a string representation of a recent year with, for example `zxcvbn("2000")` throws the following error ('_sre.SRE_Match' object is not subscriptable):

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "C:/Users/Me/PycharmProjects/Test/pass.py", line 5, in <module>
        print(zxcvbn("2000"))
      File "C:\Python34\lib\site-packages\zxcvbn\__init__.py", line 13, in zxcvbn
        result = scoring.most_guessable_match_sequence(password, matches)
      File "C:\Python34\lib\site-packages\zxcvbn\scoring.py", line 199, in most_guessable_match_sequence
        update(m, 1)
      File "C:\Python34\lib\site-packages\zxcvbn\scoring.py", line 111, in update
        pi = estimate_guesses(m, password)
      File "C:\Python34\lib\site-packages\zxcvbn\scoring.py", line 241, in estimate_guesses
        guesses = estimation_functions[match['pattern']](match)
      File "C:\Python34\lib\site-packages\zxcvbn\scoring.py", line 310, in regex_guesses
        year_space = abs(int(match['regex_match'][0]) - REFERENCE_YEAR)
    TypeError: '_sre.SRE_Match' object is not subscriptable
